text:
Could this former “Real Housewives of Beverly Hills” star be headed for the big house?

According to E! Online, Kim Richards’ lawyer appeared in court on Friday to deliver an update about the 450 community service hours the reality star was expected to have completed by Thursday.

The attorney confirmed to the outlet that Richards, 52, had done 180 of the 450 hours she was assigned. In March, it was said that the former child actress could face jail time if she failed to complete the service as ordered.

At the time, E! reported that Commissioner Jane Godfrey told Richards’ lawyer she could avoid sentencing on good cause.

To prove that, Richards’ attorney would have to provide evidence that she was making progress on completing the service.

Richards’ team provided proof of service to the court including a written letter from the facility in which the volunteer work was completed, along with an update about the quality of her service, according to E!

According to E!, Richards now has until Dec. 19, 2017 to complete the remaining 270 hours of her community service.

Days earlier, the ex “Real Housewives” star told E! her experience in recovery “has been amazing.”

She claimed that doing community service at Skydog Ranch had been instrumental in keeping her on the straight and narrow.

“This has been a huge part of it and has helped me a lot,” she told E! “The Sanctuary keeps me grounded and keeps me at peace and is healthy for me. It’s been amazing for me and me coming here has really been a major part of keeping me sober.”

Richards was ordered to complete community service after she was arrested for allegedly causing a scene at the Beverly Hills Hotel in 2015.
title: Kim Richards is running out of time to complete court ordered community service
